intro: Eriocaulon hondoense var. stenopetalum, commonly known as the Hondo narrow-petaled rush, is a flowering plant native to Japan. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and rushes. The plant is characterized by its slender, grass-like stems and small, clustered inflorescences. Its leaves are typically narrow and cylindrical, with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks.
